page.title: 06Burnhouse Farm,Kirknewton.
page.content: { THE FARM Mr Russell bought Burnhouse Farm 20 years ago.It is a dairy farm with 70 cows.Mr Russell has one helper, Margaret, who helps to feed and milk the cows.Mr and Mrs Russell have 100 acres of land.The crops they grow are barley and fodder beet. Mr Russell's milk goes to Glasgow.It makes butter,cheese and yoghurt. This summer has been wet.The barley had to be dried indoors. {A TYPICAL DAY ON THE FARM {06.00:}get up and milk cows {08.00:}breakfast and rest {08.30:}feed the cows {10.00:}work on crops {12.00:}dinner {13.00:}outside work on tractor {15.00:}cup of tea {15.30:}milk cows {17.00:}tea by Mark,Alexander
